adjectives.description: circumbendibus (comparative more circumbendibus, superlative most circumbendibus)

examples: “We’re all circumbendibus, / Wherever we may be, / We’re all circumbendibus, / On land or on sea. / Rich or poor or middling, / Wherever we are found, / We’re all circumbendibus, / We’re all going round.”

entries.meaning: (often humorous) A roundabout route or process
examples: If, as Coleridge says, “a knave is a fool with a circumbendibus,” then by instructing the knave you do but make the circumbendibus a wider one.

entries.meaning: (often humorous) A roundabout, indirect, or confusing manner of speech or writing
